weather.info: Natural light exposure regulates your circadian rhythm, improving sleep quality and daytime energy.
weather.rec_early_sunrise: Early sunrise. Take advantage of natural light to wake up naturally and regulate your circadian rhythm.
weather.rec_late_sunrise: Late sunrise. Consider using a natural light lamp when waking up to activate your body.
weather.rec_sunset: Sunset is at {time}. Reduce bright lights 2-3 hours before bed to prepare your body.
weather.rec_short_day: Short day (winter). Increase your natural light exposure during the day to maintain energy.
weather.rec_long_day: Long day (summer). Use blackout curtains for better sleep. Early light may wake your body prematurely.

recommendations.title: Recommendations
recommendations.good: Excellent! You're sleeping well (7-9 hours). Keep this routine.
recommendations.low: You're sleeping too little (less than 7 hours). Try going to bed earlier.
recommendations.high: You're sleeping too much (more than 9 hours). It may be a sign of accumulated fatigue.
tips: Keep your room cool and dark
Exercise regularly, but not before bedtime
recommendations.personal_low: You only slept {hours} hours. Your body needs more rest. Try going to bed 1-2 hours earlier tonight.
recommendations.personal_moderate: {hours} hours is barely enough. Consider adding 30-60 more minutes of sleep to optimize your energy.
recommendations.personal_good: Excellent! {hours} hours is the ideal amount. Maintain this schedule to maximize your performance.
recommendations.personal_high: You slept {hours} hours. This may indicate accumulated fatigue or recovery needs. Observe how you feel during the day.
recommendations.quality_poor: Poor sleep quality. Check: room temperature (18-22Â°C), ambient noise, light, and mattress comfort.
recommendations.quality_fair: Fair quality. Consider: reducing screens before bed, avoiding caffeine after 2 PM, and establishing a relaxing routine.
recommendations.quality_excellent: Excellent sleep quality! Try to identify what you did differently and repeat these habits.
recommendations.time_optimal: Optimal bedtime ({time}). This is a good range for most people. Maintain this consistency.
recommendations.time_early: You went to bed early ({time}). This can work if you wake up early too. Keep consistency with your wake time.
recommendations.time_late: You fell asleep past midnight ({time}). Try to advance your bedtime gradually in 15-30 minute intervals.
recommendations.time_very_late: Very late schedule ({time}). Sleeping at dawn disrupts your circadian rhythm. Seek help if this is frequent.
recommendations.time_unusual: Unusual schedule ({time}). If you work nights, use blackout curtains. If not, try to regularize your sleep schedule.
